segment.source: Resetting the device addresses a number of key scenarios: A user may want to reset a device to transfer it to another owner.
segment.target: Resetting the device addresses a number of key scenarios: A user may want to reset a device to transfer it to another owner.

segment.source: Resetting a mobile device
segment.target: Resetting a mobile device

segment.source: Resetting a mobile device
segment.target: Resetting a mobile device

segment.source: Resetting the device addresses a number of key scenarios:
segment.target: Resetting the device addresses a number of key scenarios:

segment.source: A user may want to reset a device to transfer it to another owner.
segment.target: A user may want to reset a device to transfer it to another owner.

segment.source: The device has been lost or stolen and the owner wants to remotely reset the device
segment.target: The device has been lost or stolen and the owner wants to remotely reset the device

segment.source: The device belongs to an organization, and the organization wants to remotely reset the device.
segment.target: The device belongs to an organization, and the organization wants to remotely reset the device.

segment.source: For example, when an employee leaves the organization.
segment.target: For example, when an employee leaves the organization.

segment.source: The device has malfunctioned and the user wants to reset the device.
segment.target: The device has malfunctioned and the user wants to reset the device.

segment.source: An OEM has completed factory testing and wants to reset the device (optionally preserving preloaded map data).
segment.target: An OEM has completed factory testing and wants to reset the device (optionally preserving preloaded map data).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When you reset a device, it does not return it to the original factory state.
segment.target: When you reset a device, it does not return it to the original factory state.

segment.source: For example, any packages that were added or modified during an update remain.
segment.target: For example, any packages that were added or modified during an update remain.

segment.source: To return the device to the original factory state, you must flash it with the original factory image.
segment.target: To return the device to the original factory state, you must flash it with the original factory image.

segment.source: Ways to reset a mobile device
segment.target: Ways to reset a mobile device

segment.source: The following reset options are available to different types of users.
segment.target: The following reset options are available to different types of users.

segment.source: End users
segment.target: End users

segment.source: End users can invoke a reset by the following options:
segment.target: End users can invoke a reset by the following options:

segment.source: If Settings is accessible, tap SettingsSystemAboutReset your phone.
segment.target: If Settings is accessible, tap SettingsSystemAboutReset your phone.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the device is not responsive, the user should first try restarting it; see Restarting the OS later in this topic.
segment.target: If the device is not responsive, the user should first try restarting it; see Restarting the OS later in this topic.

segment.source: If Settings is not accessible, perform the following steps:
segment.target: If Settings is not accessible, perform the following steps:

segment.source: Turn off the device.
segment.target: Turn off the device.

segment.source: Turn on the device while holding down the volume down button until the exclamation mark appears on the screen.
segment.target: Turn on the device while holding down the volume down button until the exclamation mark appears on the screen.

segment.source: Press the following four buttons in this order: volume up, volume down, power, volume down.
segment.target: Press the following four buttons in this order: volume up, volume down, power, volume down.

segment.source: Use the erase function on the WindowsPhone.com website to reset a device remotely.
segment.target: Use the erase function on the WindowsPhone.com website to reset a device remotely.

segment.source: For more information, see Find a lost phone.
segment.target: For more information, see Find a lost phone.

segment.source: Partners
segment.target: Partners

segment.source: In addition to the options listed in the previous section, partners such as OEMs and mobile operators have the following additional options for invoking a reset:
segment.target: In addition to the options listed in the previous section, partners such as OEMs and mobile operators have the following additional options for invoking a reset:

segment.source: A reset can be invoked programmatically during manufacturing scenarios by calling the ResetPhone or ResetPhoneEx function.
segment.target: A reset can be invoked programmatically during manufacturing scenarios by calling the ResetPhone or ResetPhoneEx function.

segment.source: In non-retail images (that is, images where the ReleaseType element in the OEMInput file is set to Test), a reset can be invoked through the developer boot menu.
segment.target: In non-retail images (that is, images where the ReleaseType element in the OEMInput file is set to Test), a reset can be invoked through the developer boot menu.

segment.source: Note The end user factory reset process is not designed for use on the factory floor.
segment.target: Note The end user factory reset process is not designed for use on the factory floor.

segment.source: We recommend resetting the phone programmatically in factory or refurbishment settings.
segment.target: We recommend resetting the phone programmatically in factory or refurbishment settings.

segment.source: It is faster than resetting the phone by using SettingsSystemAboutReset your phone.
segment.target: It is faster than resetting the phone by using SettingsSystemAboutReset your phone.

segment.source: You can verify that all data was successfully removed by using GetResetLogs.exe.
segment.target: You can verify that all data was successfully removed by using GetResetLogs.exe.

segment.source: The log files will show you any files that were not removed after the device was reset.
segment.target: The log files will show you any files that were not removed after the device was reset.

segment.source: Enterprises
segment.target: Enterprises

segment.source: In enterprise scenarios where mobile devices are managed using device management software, a reset can be invoked remotely by the following options:
segment.target: In enterprise scenarios where mobile devices are managed using device management software, a reset can be invoked remotely by the following options:

segment.source: A reset can be invoked by using the RemoteWipe policy setting with Exchange ActiveSync.
segment.target: A reset can be invoked by using the RemoteWipe policy setting with Exchange ActiveSync.

segment.source: For more info, see the Windows Phone Exchange ActiveSync Overview white paper on the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: For more info, see the Windows Phone Exchange ActiveSync Overview white paper on the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: A reset can be invoked by using OMA DM.
segment.target: A reset can be invoked by using OMA DM.

segment.source: For more info, see RemoteWipe CSP.
segment.target: For more info, see RemoteWipe CSP.

segment.source: Operations performed by phone reset
segment.target: Operations performed by phone reset

segment.source: A reset performs the following operations:
segment.target: A reset performs the following operations:

segment.source: It uses the chkdsk tool to scan the main OS for corruption issues, and it tries to automatically fix the issues if any are found.
segment.target: It uses the chkdsk tool to scan the main OS for corruption issues, and it tries to automatically fix the issues if any are found.

segment.source: If the reset operation is initiated by using the ResetPhoneEx function with the RESETPRESERVEUSERSTOREDATA flag, the operation also scans the user data partition.
segment.target: If the reset operation is initiated by using the ResetPhoneEx function with the RESETPRESERVEUSERSTOREDATA flag, the operation also scans the user data partition.

segment.source: It executes a quick format of the user data partition.
segment.target: It executes a quick format of the user data partition.

segment.source: All pre-populated data (such as map data) on the user data partition is deleted and will need to be reloaded.
segment.target: All pre-populated data (such as map data) on the user data partition is deleted and will need to be reloaded.

segment.source: It removes any user-installed Store apps.
segment.target: It removes any user-installed Store apps.

segment.source: The user can use the backup and restore feature to restore the installed apps.
segment.target: The user can use the backup and restore feature to restore the installed apps.

segment.source: It removes from the OS partition any files that are not described by packages.
segment.target: It removes from the OS partition any files that are not described by packages.

segment.source: Because updates are described in packages, updates will be present after a reset.
segment.target: Because updates are described in packages, updates will be present after a reset.

segment.source: It recreates the registry by using a stored copy that was saved during first boot, to which it adds all of the registry changes that have been received in update packages.
segment.target: It recreates the registry by using a stored copy that was saved during first boot, to which it adds all of the registry changes that have been received in update packages.

segment.source: If device encryption is enabled before the reset operation, it permanently deletes the active device encryption key.
segment.target: If device encryption is enabled before the reset operation, it permanently deletes the active device encryption key.

segment.source: However, device encryption will continue to be enabled using a different encryption key after the reset operation.
segment.target: However, device encryption will continue to be enabled using a different encryption key after the reset operation.

segment.source: If the device has an SD card, in some scenarios the SD card is also reformatted.
segment.target: If the device has an SD card, in some scenarios the SD card is also reformatted.

segment.source: For more details, see Reformatting the SD card later in this topic.
segment.target: For more details, see Reformatting the SD card later in this topic.

segment.source: The following items persist across a reset:
segment.target: The following items persist across a reset:

segment.source: Update packages that have been delivered to the device and installed by the user.
segment.target: Update packages that have been delivered to the device and installed by the user.

segment.source: Registry changes that were delivered in updates.
segment.target: Registry changes that were delivered in updates.

segment.source: All data in the DPP partition, such as calibration data.
segment.target: All data in the DPP partition, such as calibration data.

segment.source: The contents of the Main OS and user data partitions are reset as described previously.
segment.target: The contents of the Main OS and user data partitions are reset as described previously.

segment.source: Anything stored in the other OS partitions does persist.
segment.target: Anything stored in the other OS partitions does persist.

segment.source: Static cold-boot provisioning XML.
segment.target: Static cold-boot provisioning XML.

segment.source: If the reset operation is initiated by using the ResetPhoneEx function, certain data in the user store can be optionally preserved by specifying RESETPRESERVEUSERSTOREDATA in the dwFlags parameter.
segment.target: If the reset operation is initiated by using the ResetPhoneEx function, certain data in the user store can be optionally preserved by specifying RESETPRESERVEUSERSTOREDATA in the dwFlags parameter.

segment.source: Currently, the only user store data that is preserved is pre-loaded map data.
segment.target: Currently, the only user store data that is preserved is pre-loaded map data.

segment.source: Reformatting the SD card
segment.target: Reformatting the SD card

segment.source: If the device includes an SD card, the SD card can be reformatted in the following reset scenarios:
segment.target: If the device includes an SD card, the SD card can be reformatted in the following reset scenarios:

segment.source: The user initiates a reset operation in system settings, and the user chooses the option to reformat the SD card along with resetting the device.
segment.target: The user initiates a reset operation in system settings, and the user chooses the option to reformat the SD card along with resetting the device.

segment.source: The user initiates a reset operation remotely from the WindowsPhone.com website.
segment.target: The user initiates a reset operation remotely from the WindowsPhone.com website.

segment.source: In this scenario, the reset operation automatically reformats the SD card; there is no option for keeping the SD card contents.
segment.target: In this scenario, the reset operation automatically reformats the SD card; there is no option for keeping the SD card contents.

segment.source: The reset operation is initiated remotely on a managed device by using Exchange ActiveSync or using OMA-DM and the RemoteWipe configuration service provider.
segment.target: The reset operation is initiated remotely on a managed device by using Exchange ActiveSync or using OMA-DM and the RemoteWipe configuration service provider.

segment.source: In this scenario, the reset operation automatically reformats the SD card; there is no option for keeping the SD card contents.
segment.target: In this scenario, the reset operation automatically reformats the SD card; there is no option for keeping the SD card contents.

segment.source: For more information, see RemoteWipe CSP.
segment.target: For more information, see RemoteWipe CSP.

segment.source: The reset operation is initiated programmatically by a partner application that uses the ResetPhone or ResetPhoneEx function in the following ways:
segment.target: The reset operation is initiated programmatically by a partner application that uses the ResetPhone or ResetPhoneEx function in the following ways:

segment.source: ResetPhone: Pass TRUE to the bWipeStorageCard parameter.
segment.target: ResetPhone: Pass TRUE to the bWipeStorageCard parameter.

segment.source: ResetPhoneEx: Pass RESETWIPESD to the dwFlags parameter.
segment.target: ResetPhoneEx: Pass RESETWIPESD to the dwFlags parameter.

segment.source: In each of these scenarios, the OS attempts to execute a quick format of the SD card.
segment.target: In each of these scenarios, the OS attempts to execute a quick format of the SD card.

segment.source: If the attempt to reformat the SD card is unsuccessful, the operation proceeds with the rest of the reset process.
segment.target: If the attempt to reformat the SD card is unsuccessful, the operation proceeds with the rest of the reset process.

segment.source: OMA provisioning and resetting the device
segment.target: OMA provisioning and resetting the device

segment.source: OMA Client Provisioning and OMA Device Management (DM) settings that are stored in the modem are retained when the device is reset.
segment.target: OMA Client Provisioning and OMA Device Management (DM) settings that are stored in the modem are retained when the device is reset.

segment.source: Registry settings that are changed by provisioning are not retained when the device is reset.
segment.target: Registry settings that are changed by provisioning are not retained when the device is reset.

segment.source: For more information, see RemoteWipe CSP.
segment.target: For more information, see RemoteWipe CSP.

segment.source: Persisting provisioned content from the workplace
segment.target: Persisting provisioned content from the workplace

segment.source: If the device has been applied with provisioning packages or the organization uses EnterpriseExtFileSystem configuration service provider to push down provisioned content to a persistent location, the provisioned content can be persisted with a reset using the following ways:
segment.target: If the device has been applied with provisioning packages or the organization uses EnterpriseExtFileSystem configuration service provider to push down provisioned content to a persistent location, the provisioned content can be persisted with a reset using the following ways:

segment.source: The user initiates a reset operation in system settings, and the user chooses the option to persist the provisioned content from the workplace.
segment.target: The user initiates a reset operation in system settings, and the user chooses the option to persist the provisioned content from the workplace.

segment.source: The reset operation is initiated remotely on a managed device by using OMA-DM and the RemoteWipe configuration service provider (doWipePersistProvisionedData node).
segment.target: The reset operation is initiated remotely on a managed device by using OMA-DM and the RemoteWipe configuration service provider (doWipePersistProvisionedData node).

segment.source: For more info about the RemoteWipe configuration service provider and EnterpriseExtFileSystem configuration service provider, see RemoteWipe CSP.
segment.target: For more info about the RemoteWipe configuration service provider and EnterpriseExtFileSystem configuration service provider, see RemoteWipe CSP.

segment.source: Restarting the OS
segment.target: Restarting the OS

segment.source: If the device is not responsive to the normal shutdown procedure or the power button alone, the device can be forced to restart by using a combination of buttons.
segment.target: If the device is not responsive to the normal shutdown procedure or the power button alone, the device can be forced to restart by using a combination of buttons.

segment.source: This procedure does not reset the device; instead, it provides an alternate way to restart an unresponsive device.
segment.target: This procedure does not reset the device; instead, it provides an alternate way to restart an unresponsive device.

segment.source: To restart the device, press and hold both the volume down button and the power button for 10 seconds.
segment.target: To restart the device, press and hold both the volume down button and the power button for 10 seconds.
